intro: Monochaetum bracteolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistletoe, is an epiphytic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Santalaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. It typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other hardwood trees, forming dense, shrub-like structures. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
